title: How to Reuse an Old Candle

steps.headline: Take out the candle you'd like to reuse.
Plug the candle warmer in the socket and turn it on.
Place the candle in a jar, if it's  not already in one.
Put the candle on the candle warmer hot plate.
steps.description: Exercise caution while working with the hot plate.

steps.headline: Allow time for the old candle to completely melt.
Dip the new wick into the melted wax.
steps.description: Be careful while doing this, as you can easily burn yourself.

steps.headline: Give it a few minutes to dry.
steps.description: It should do this relatively quickly.

steps.headline: Dip the wick again in the melted wax.
Let it dry for a few minutes.
steps.description: Make sure the wick is well coated.

steps.headline: Place the wick into the empty jar.
steps.description: You should wash your hands after this, because your hands are probably covered in wax.

steps.headline: Pour the wax into the jar with the wick.
steps.description: Make sure the jar doesn't overflow, because this can create a big mess. The melted wax will still be hot, so don't burn yourself. It's a good idea to use oven mitts for this part.

steps.headline: Take the wick out of the jar carefully.
Allow to dry and harden.
steps.description: This could take up to a day, depending on the temperature. For immediate drying, place it in the sun outside.

steps.headline: Place it in a safe area
Take a lighter, light the candle, and enjoy its fragrance.
